t: Luke 19
Jesus Comes to Zacchaeus’ House
Then*p Jesus*i entered and passed through Jericho.
Now behold, there*i was*i a man named Zacchaeus who was a chief tax collector, and he was rich.
And he sought to see who Jesus was, but could not because of the crowd, for he was of short stature.
So he ran ahead and climbed up into a sycamore tree to see Him, for He was going to pass that way.*i
And when Jesus came to the place, He looked up and saw him, and said to him, “Zacchaeus,*r make*r haste*r and*r come*r down,*r for*r today*r I*r must*r stay*r at*r your*r house.”*r
So he made haste and came down, and received Him joyfully.
But when they saw it,*i they all complained, saying, “He has gone to be a guest with a man who is a sinner.”
Then*p Zacchaeus stood and said to the Lord, “Look, Lord, I give half of my goods to the poor; and if I have taken anything from anyone by false accusation, I restore fourfold.”
And*p Jesus said to him, “Today*r salvation*r has*r come*r to*r this*r house,*r because*r he*r also*r is*r a*r son*r of*r Abraham;*r
for*r the*r Son*r of*r Man*r has*r come*r to*r seek*r and*r to*r save*r that*r which*r was*r lost.”*r
The Parable of the Minas
Now*p as they heard these things, He spoke another parable, because He was near Jerusalem and because they thought the kingdom of God would appear immediately.
Therefore He said: “A*r certain*r nobleman*r went*r into*r a*r far*r country*r to*r receive*r for*r himself*r a*r kingdom*r and*r to*r return.*r
So*r he*r called*r ten*r of*r his*r servants,*r delivered*r to*r them*r ten*r minas,*r and*r said*r to*r them,*r ‘Do*r business*r till*r I*r come.’*r
But*r his*r citizens*r hated*r him,*r and*r sent*r a*r delegation*r after*r him,*r saying,*r ‘We*r will*r not*r have*r this*r man*ir to*r reign*r over*r us.’*r

“And*rp so*r it*r was*r that*r when*r he*r returned,*r having*r received*r the*r kingdom,*r he*r then*r commanded*r these*r servants,*r to*r whom*r he*r had*r given*r the*r money,*r to*r be*r called*r to*r him,*r that*r he*r might*r know*r how*r much*r every*r man*r had*r gained*r by*r trading.*r
Then*r came*r the*r first,*r saying,*r ‘Master,*r your*r mina*r has*r earned*r ten*r minas.’*r
And*r he*r said*r to*r him,*r ‘Well*r done,*ir good*r servant;*r because*r you*r were*r faithful*r in*r a*r very*r little,*r have*r authority*r over*r ten*r cities.’*r
And*r the*r second*r came,*r saying,*r ‘Master,*r your*r mina*r has*r earned*r five*r minas.’*r
Likewise*r he*r said*r to*r him,*r ‘You*r also*r be*r over*r five*r cities.’*r
“Then*p another came, saying, ‘Master,*r here*r is*r your*r mina,*r which*r I*r have*r kept*r put*r away*r in*r a*r handkerchief.*r
For*r I*r feared*r you,*r because*r you*r are*r an*r austere*r man.*r You*r collect*r what*r you*r did*r not*r deposit,*r and*r reap*r what*r you*r did*r not*r sow.’*r

And*r he*r said*r to*r him,*r ‘Out*r of*r your*r own*r mouth*r I*r will*r judge*r you,*r you*ir wicked*r servant.*r You*r knew*r that*r I*r was*r an*r austere*r man,*r collecting*r what*r I*r did*r not*r deposit*r and*r reaping*r what*r I*r did*r not*r sow.*r
Why*r then*r did*r you*r not*r put*r my*r money*r in*r the*r bank,*r that*r at*r my*r coming*r I*r might*r have*r collected*r it*r with*r interest?’*r
“And*rp he*r said*r to*r those*r who*r stood*r by,*r ‘Take*r the*r mina*r from*r him,*r and*r give*r it*ir to*r him*r who*r has*r ten*r minas.’*r
(But*r they*r said*r to*r him,*r ‘Master,*r he*r has*r ten*r minas.’)*r
‘For*r I*r say*r to*r you,*r that*r to*r everyone*r who*r has*r will*r be*r given;*r and*r from*r him*r who*r does*r not*r have,*r even*r what*r he*r has*r will*r be*r taken*r away*r from*r him.*r
But*r bring*r here*r those*r enemies*r of*r mine,*r who*r did*r not*r want*r me*r to*r reign*r over*r them,*r and*r slay*r them*ir before*r me.’”*r
The Triumphal Entry
When*p He had said this, He went on ahead, going up to Jerusalem.
And it came to pass, when He drew near to Bethphage and Bethany, at the mountain called Olivet, that*i He sent two of His disciples,

saying, “Go*r into*r the*r village*r opposite*r you,*ir where*r as*r you*r enter*r you*r will*r find*r a*r colt*r tied,*r on*r which*r no*r one*r has*r ever*r sat.*r Loose*r it*r and*r bring*r it*ir here.*ir
And*r if*r anyone*r asks*r you,*r ‘Why*r are*r you*r loosing*r it?’*ir thus*r you*r shall*r say*r to*r him,*r ‘Because*r the*r Lord*r has*r need*r of*r it.’”*r
So*p those who were sent went their way and found it*i just as He had said to them.
But as they were loosing the colt, the owners of it said to them, “Why are you loosing the colt?”
And*p they said, “The Lord has need of him.”
Then they brought him to Jesus. And they threw their own clothes on the colt, and they set Jesus on him.
And as He went, many*i spread their clothes on the road.
Then,*p as He was now drawing near the descent of the Mount of Olives, the whole multitude of the disciples began to rejoice and praise God with a loud voice for all the mighty works they had seen,
saying: “‘Blessed*pn is*i the King who comes in the name of the Lord!’*sb Peace*ld in heaven and glory in the highest!”
And*p some of the Pharisees called to Him from the crowd, “Teacher, rebuke Your disciples.”
But*p He answered and said to them, “I*r tell*r you*r that*r if*r these*r should*r keep*r silent,*r the*r stones*r would*r immediately*r cry*r out.”*r
Jesus Weeps over Jerusalem
Now*p as He drew near, He saw the city and wept over it,
saying, “If*r you*r had*r known,*r even*r you,*r especially*r in*r this*r your*r day,*r the*r things*r that*ir make*ir for*r your*r peace!*r But*r now*r they*r are*r hidden*r from*r your*r eyes.*r
For*r days*r will*r come*r upon*r you*r when*r your*r enemies*r will*r build*r an*r embankment*r around*r you,*r surround*r you*r and*r close*r you*r in*r on*r every*r side,*r

and*r level*r you,*r and*r your*r children*r within*r you,*r to*r the*r ground;*r and*r they*r will*r not*r leave*r in*r you*r one*r stone*r upon*r another,*r because*r you*r did*r not*r know*r the*r time*r of*r your*r visitation.”*r
Jesus Cleanses the Temple
Then*p He went into the temple and began to drive out those who bought and sold in it,
saying to them, “It*r is*r written,*r ‘My*r house*r is*r a*r house*r of*r prayer,’*r but*r you*r have*r made*r it*r a*r ‘den*r of*r thieves.’”*r
And*p He was teaching daily in the temple. But the chief priests, the scribes, and the leaders of the people sought to destroy Him,
and were unable to do anything; for all the people were very attentive to hear Him.
